facts: A baseball field has four bases—first, second, third, and home plate—and runners try to touch them in order to score a run.
A standard baseball game is nine innings long, and each inning ends when the defensive team records three outs.
A home run happens when the batter hits the ball in fair territory and can run around all four bases without being put out.
In Major League Baseball, the pitcher throws from a rubber that is 60 feet 6 inches away from home plate.
A strikeout occurs when a batter gets three strikes, which can be swinging and missing or not swinging at a pitch in the strike zone.
A double play is when the defense gets two outs during the same play, often by quickly throwing the ball between fielders.
The World Series is the championship series of Major League Baseball, played between the American League and National League champions.
